page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: A SMALL VILLAGE OF 716 INHABITANTS 4 MILES E. OF BEDFORD,IN A MAINLY AGRICULTURAL AREA.IT HAS A VILLAGE STORE WITH POST-OFFICE,"THE CROWN"PUBLIC HOUSE,GARAGE AND PETROL SERVICES.PINE FURNITURE IS MADE AND THERE IS A FORGE, MAINLY FOR SHOEING HORSES. THE NATIONAL TRUST ADMINISTERS A TUDOR DOVECOTE AND STABLES,AND CLOSEBY IS A MAINLY TUDOR CHURCH. THE METHODIST CHAPEL IS VICTORIAN AS IS THE SCHOOL FOR PUPILS AGED 5-9YEARS,BUT IT HAS A MODERN <1970>EXTENSION. THERE ARE STILL SOME ELIZABETHAN THATCHED COTTAGES REMAINING. THE RIVER GREAT OUSE FLOWS ALONGSIDE AND PLEASURE CRAFT ARE ABLE TO GO FROM BEDFORD TO KINGS LYNN.
